ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: SDSC: Number of hours/days/weeks/months/years being assessed
SDSC: Unit of time being assessed
Notes: 1=Hour(s); 2=Day(s); 3=Week(s); 4=Month(s); 5=Year(s); 6=Lifetime

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: How many hours of sleep does your child get on most nights?
Notes: 1=9-11 hours; 2=8-9 hours; 3=7-8 hours; 4=5-7 hours; 5=Less than 5 hours

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: How long after going to bed does your child usually fall asleep?
Notes: 1=Less than 15 minutes; 2=15-30 minutes; 3=30-45 minutes; 4=45-60 minutes; 5=More than 60 minutes

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child goes to bed reluctantly.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child has difficulty getting to sleep at night.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child feels anxious or afraid when falling asleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child startles or jerks parts of the body while falling asleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child shows repetitive actions such as rocking or head banging while falling asleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child experience vivid dream-like scenes while falling asleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child sweats excessively while falling asleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child wakes up more than twice per night.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: After waking up in the night, your child has difficulty falling asleep again.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child has frequent twitching or jerking of legs while asleep or often changes position during the night or kicks the covers off the bed.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child has difficulty breathing during the night.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child gasps for breath or is unable to breathe during sleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child snores.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child sweats excessively during the night.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: You have observed your child sleepwalking.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: You have observed your child talking in their sleep.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child grinds their teeth.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child wakes from sleep screaming or confused so that you cannot seem to get through to them.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child has nightmares.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child is unusually difficult to wake up in the morning.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child awakes in the morning feeling tired.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child feels unable to move when waking up in the morning.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child experiences daytime somnolence (drowsiness).
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Please answer the following statements about your child's sleep over the specified time period: Your child falls asleep suddenly in inappropriate situations.
Notes: 1=Never; 2=Occasionally (once or twice per month or less); 3=Sometimes (once or twice per week); 4=Often (3 to 5 times per week); 5=Always (daily); 6=Don't know

ElementDescription: Disorders of initiating and maintaining sleep (sum the score of items 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 11)
Sleep breathing disorders (sum the score of items 13, 14, 15)
Disorders of arousal (sum the score of items 17, 20, 21)
Sleep-wake transition disorders (sum the score of items 6, 7, 8, 12, 18, 19)
Disorders of excessive somnolence (sum the score of items 22, 23, 24, 25, 26)
Sleep hyperhydrosis (sum the score of items 9, 16)
SDSC Total score (sum the score of all 26 items)
